A 6.7 magnitude earthquake
shook the southern Philippines
on November 17. Authorities
said at least one person was killed and
18 others were injured. Many buildings were
damaged.  According to Duc Tran Geological Science Base, the
earthquake occurred within seconds
off the coast of Minano Island at a distance of 60 km. The
normal number was recorded in the town of Ve
Tuong Clan near the epicenter by the Philippine Geological Agency
and the Wave Warning Center.  The
Pacific God said the
earthquake did not cause a tsunami. However,
Philippine authorities warned that aftershocks
could
